de.lmu.ifi.mfa

Interface IGraph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Graph

    interface IGraph
    The IGraph interface represents a directed graph that can be used to implement a flow network. It supports the following two primary functionalities: create and manipulate the directed graph, evaluate and manipulate the flow on the network.

    The interface provides methods to add and remove vertices or edges. Furthermore, it contains auxiliary functions that allow an easy implementation of Dinic's and Goldberg-Tarjan's maximum flow algorithms..

    Additionally, the interface provides methods to query data about the current state of the flow network in an integer based representation.

    For additional information, see MFA by Christian Gebhardt on Github.

    Since:
    2016-09-03
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gebhardt

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        boolean addVertex(int vertexId)
        Add new vertex to the graph. Nothing happens, when the vertex already exists.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier to be added.
        Returns:
        true when the vertex was added to the graph, otherwise false.

      • removeVertex

        boolean removeVertex(int vertexId)
        Remove a vertex from the graph. Nothing happens, when the vertex does not exists.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier to be removed.
        Returns:
        true when the vertex is removed from the graph, otherwise false.

      • containsVertex

        boolean containsVertex(int vertexId)
        Checks the existence of a vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier that is searched for.
        Returns:
        true when the vertex is in the graph, otherwise false.

      • addEdge

        boolean addEdge(int vertexId1,
                int vertexId2,
                int capacity)
        Add an edge to the graph of the flow network. When the edge already exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity of the edge.
        Returns:
        true when the add operation was successful, otherwise false.

      • removeEdge

        boolean removeEdge(int vertexId1,
                   int vertexId2)
        Remove an edge from the graph of the flow network. The adjacent vertices are untouched. When the edge does not exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge.
        Returns:
        true when the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.

      • resetFlow

        boolean resetFlow()
        Reset the flow on the whole graph. The method sets the flow to zero for each individual edge.
        Returns:
        true when it was successful for every edge, otherwise false.

      • resetExcess

        boolean resetExcess(int startVertexId)
        Reset the excess on the whole graph. The method sets the excess to zero for all vertices except the start vertex. The start vertex excess is set to infinity.
        Parameters:
        startVertexId - the start vertex identifier.
        Returns:
        true when the operation was successful, otherwise false.

      • initializeLabels

        boolean initializeLabels(int startVertexId)
        Initialize the valid labeling on the whole graph. The method sets the labels to zero for all vertices except the start vertex. The start vertex label is set to n.
        Parameters:
        startVertexId - the start vertex identifier.
        Returns:
        true when the initialization was successful, otherwise false.

      • buildResidualGraph

        void buildResidualGraph()
        Build the residual graph of the directed graph. The method adds all edges in an adjacent list to its end vertex as residual edge-

      • buildLayeredNetwork

        int buildLayeredNetwork(int startVertexId,
                        int endVertexId)
        Build a layered network of a flow network. This method assigns the layer number to each vertex in the graph. The layered network is built in place withing the original graph.
        Parameters:
        startVertexId - the start vertex identifier, where from the layered network is built up.
        endVertexId - the end vertex identifier, which defines the highest layer in the network.
        Returns:
        the number of layers in the network.

      • searchAugmentingPath

        boolean searchAugmentingPath(int sourceVertexId,
                             int sinkVertexId)
        Search an augmenting path in a graph by using a layered network. This method uses depth-first search to find an augmenting path in a flow graph. Vertices are marked as dead during the search to successively. When the search is successful, the augmenting path is stored in an auxiliary variable.
        Parameters:
        sourceVertexId - the source vertex identifier from where to search an augmenting path.
        sinkVertexId - the sink vertex identifier,which defines the termination condition for the search.
        Returns:
        the success status, if an augmenting path was found.

      • updateMinFlowIncrement

        int updateMinFlowIncrement()
        Updates the flow along an augmenting path. When an augmenting path is found and stored in an auxiliary variable, this function updates the flow along this augmenting path. It increasing the flow by the maximum allowed amount.
        Returns:
        the amount of the flow increment.

      • initialPush

        int initialPush(int sourceVertexId,
                int sinkVertexId)
        Initial push to start the push-relabel algorithm. This method pushes the maximum flow from the source vertex to all its neighbors. The neighbors are added to the queue of active vertices, except of the sink vertex.
        Parameters:
        sourceVertexId - the source vertex identifier, from where the initial push is performed.
        sinkVertexId - the sink vertex identifier to except the sink from the active vertices.
        Returns:
        the number of active vertices in the queue.

      • dischargeQueue

        int dischargeQueue()
        Perform a discharge operation on the first vertex in the queue. This method applies push- and relabel-operations on the first active vertex. All vertices that become active during this operations are added to the rear of the queue. When the current vertex is relabeled without becoming inactive, it is also added to the rear of the queue.
        Returns:
        the number of active vertices in the queue.

      • getOutFlow

        int getOutFlow(int vertexId)
        Calculate and return the outgoing flow of a vertex. This method iterates through all outgoing edges and sums up the total outgoing flow.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier from which the outgoing flow is calculated.
        Returns:
        the outgoing flow of the vertex.

      • getInFlow

        int getInFlow(int vertexId)
        Calculate and return the incoming flow of a vertex. This method iterates through all incominig edges and sums up the total ingoing flow.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier from which the incoming flow is calculated.
        Returns:
        the incoming flow of the vertex.

      • graphToString

        java.lang.String graphToString()
        Get the graph data in form of a text based format. This method returns a String that contains a list of all adjacent lists. Each adjacent list is represented through the edges of the form (start vertex id,end vertex id,c:capacity,f:flow)
        Returns:
        the list of all edges as integer array.

      • getGraphData

        java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer[]> getGraphData()
        Get the graph data in form of an edge list. This method returns a list of all edges as integer array. Each edge is represented through a four tuple [start vertex id, end vertex id, capacity, flow]
        Returns:
        the list of all edges as integer array.

      • getVertexIndices

        java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> getVertexIndices()
        Get the graph data in form of an vertex list. This method returns a list of all vertices as integer. Each vertex is represented through its identifier as integer.
        Returns:
        the list of all vertex identifiers in the graph.
